name: Beef Banh Mi Bowls with Sriracha Mayo, Carrot & Pickled Cucumber
instructions:
Add'l ingredients: mayonnaise, siracha

1

Place [INGREDIENT:3767b450:singular] in a fine-mesh sieve and rinse until water runs clear. Add to a small pot with 1 cup water (2 cups for 4 servings) and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until [INGREDIENT:3767b450:singular] is tender, 15 minutes. Keep covered off heat for at least 10 minutes or until ready to serve.

2

Meanwhile, wash and dry all produce. Peel and finely chop garlic. Zest and quarter [INGREDIENT:67c0ecaf:singular] (for 4 servings, zest 1 [INGREDIENT:67c0ecaf:singular] and quarter both). Trim and halve [INGREDIENT:1441f197:singular] lengthwise; thinly slice crosswise into half-moons. Halve, peel, and medium dice [INGREDIENT:cf4c2232:singular]. Trim, peel, and grate carrot.

3

In a medium bowl, combine [INGREDIENT:1441f197:singular], juice from half the [INGREDIENT:67c0ecaf:singular], ¼ tsp sugar (½ tsp for 4 servings), and a pinch of salt. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, a pinch of garlic, a squeeze of [INGREDIENT:67c0ecaf:singular] juice, and as much sriracha as you’d like. Season with salt and pepper.

4

Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add [INGREDIENT:cf4c2232:singular] and cook, stirring, until softened, 4-5 minutes. Add beef, remaining garlic, and 2 tsp sugar (4 tsp for 4 servings). Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until beef is browned and cooked through, 4-5 minutes. Stir in [INGREDIENT:2c04fec4:singular]. Turn off heat; taste and season with salt and pepper.

5

Fluff [INGREDIENT:3767b450:singular] with a fork; stir in [INGREDIENT:67c0ecaf:singular] zest and 1 TBSP butter. Divide [INGREDIENT:3767b450:singular] between bowls. Arrange beef, grated carrot, and pickled [INGREDIENT:1441f197:singular] on top. Top with a squeeze of [INGREDIENT:67c0ecaf:singular] juice. Drizzle with sriracha mayo.
originalInstructions:
Add'l ingredients: mayonnaise, siracha

1

Place rice in a fine-mesh sieve and rinse until water runs clear. Add to a small pot with 1 cup water (2 cups for 4 servings) and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until rice is tender, 15 minutes. Keep covered off heat for at least 10 minutes or until ready to serve.

2

Meanwhile, wash and dry all produce. Peel and finely chop garlic. Zest and quarter lime (for 4 servings, zest 1 lime and quarter both). Trim and halve cucumber lengthwise; thinly slice crosswise into half-moons. Halve, peel, and medium dice onion. Trim, peel, and grate carrot.

3

In a medium bowl, combine cucumber, juice from half the lime, ¼ tsp sugar (½ tsp for 4 servings), and a pinch of salt. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, a pinch of garlic, a squeeze of lime juice, and as much sriracha as you’d like. Season with salt and pepper.

4

Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring, until softened, 4-5 minutes. Add beef, remaining garlic, and 2 tsp sugar (4 tsp for 4 servings). Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until beef is browned and cooked through, 4-5 minutes. Stir in soy sauce. Turn off heat; taste and season with salt and pepper.

5

Fluff rice with a fork; stir in lime zest and 1 TBSP butter. Divide rice between bowls. Arrange beef, grated carrot, and pickled cucumber on top. Top with a squeeze of lime juice. Drizzle with sriracha mayo.
